abstract.text: Acquires a new credential using a password or certificate.

inlineContent.text: The name to use to acquire the credential. Import the name using
. Ensure that the mechanism specified by the
parameter supports the name type.
The mechanism to use to acquire the credential, for example
or
. Use
to get a complete list of supported mechanisms.
A dictionary that includes either the key
to specify a password or
to name a certificate for use in acquiring the credential. It may also contain any of the other keys listed in Initial Credential Keys in
to optionally condition the operation.
A credential pointer that the function sets to point at the new credential on success, or sets to
on failure. Use
or
to release the credential’s memory when you are done with it.
An error pointer that the function sets to point at a new error object if the function call fails. Pass
to ignore this error. When an error does exist, it describes the reason for the failure, and you are responsible for releasing it with
A status code set to
if the call succeeds, or some other value indicating the reason for failure if not.
Don’t call this function on a UI update thread because it may block on network activity.

abstract.text: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.
Returns the name describing the credential.
Returns a copy of the universally unique identifier corresponding to a GSS credential.
The value that indicates an empty credential object.
The Kerberos Version 5 Mechanism (KRB5).
The Microsoft NT LAN Manager Mechanism (NTLM).
The operation completed without error.
A 32-bit unsigned integer.
Securely establish connections between endpoints.
Acquires a new credential using a password or certificate.
Acquires a credential for use in establishing a security context.
Acquires a credential for use in establishing a security context using a password.
A pointer to an immutable OID descriptor exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to exchange a credential object with GSS-API functions.
Purges a credential from memory.
Converts a name in contiguous octet format to the internal name format.
Returns the list of supported underlying security mechanisms.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate name objects with GSS-API functions.
Returns a pseudo-random byte stream for keying.
Releases the memory of a credential.
The value that indicates a certificate to use with PKINIT/PKU2U.
The value is a string that indicates a password.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A reference to a CFError object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
